Article Title: Software company lays off 150 employees to replace them with AI months after company CEO defended buying private jet for himself
Article Text:
Representative Image

How Atlassian CEO informed its employees about the layoffs



If we make call centre staff more productive, people aren‚Äôt going to call more [and] we‚Äôll probably need less call centre staff. Some parts of our economy will grow significantly as AI makes them more productive, and some parts of our economy will shrink as we do that.‚Äù

‚ÄúThere are a couple of reasons I‚Äôve purchased a plane. Personal security is the primary reason (an unfortunate reality of my world), but also so I can run a global business from Australia, and still be a constantly present dad.‚Äù

5 Tips to Get the Best Deals during sale on Amazon, Flipkart and other online websites

Jira software maker Atlassian has laid off 150 employees, a report claims. The affected roles in the Australian tech company are reportedly being replaced by new artificial intelligence (AI) technology. The latest round of job cuts comes months after Atlassian‚Äôs billionaire CEO and co-founder, Mike Cannon-Brookes, defended his purchase of a private jet. In March, Cannon-Brookes took to professional networking site LinkedIn to defend his decision to acquire a Bombardier 7500, an aircraft which is believed to cost over US$75 million, stating that this purchase would allow him to be a "present dad." The latest layoffs were also reportedly defended by Atlassian‚Äôs other co-founder and former CEO Scott Farquhar.According to a report by SkyNews Australia, Atlassian employees who were impacted in this round of job cuts were informed of the job cuts via a pre-recorded video message from Cannon-Brookes. In the video, seen by the publication, the CEO spoke from a home office in a faded green hoodie.However, the Cannon-Brookes did not name the affected individuals, who reportedly had to wait 15 minutes for an email confirming their status. Impacted staff had their laptops blocked, but are expected to receive payment for the next six months, the report noted.Meanwhile, Farquhar, Atlassian's other cofounder, has also reportedly defended the layoffs, saying that Australia‚Äôs copyright laws should be updated to allow AI companies unrestricted access to mine data.In a statement to the Sydney Morning Herald, Farquhar said: ‚ÄúEarlier this year, Atlassian faced criticism for Cannon-Brookes buying a personal jet for upwards of $75 million despite his support for climate action and promotion of solar power. He has reportedly been investing heavily in eco-friendly projects, including a solar power cable from Darwin to Singapore.In a post shared on LinkedIn, Cannon-Brookes wrote:
Article Summary: Jira software maker Atlassian has laid off 150 employees, a report claims. The affected roles in the Australian tech company are reportedly being replaced by new artificial intelligence (AI) technology. The latest round of job cuts comes months after Atlassian‚Äôs billionaire CEO and co-founder, Mike Cannon-Brookes, defended his purchase of a private jet.

Article Title: WinZO disputes Google‚Äôs CCI proposal on Play Store rules
Article Text: Bengaluru: Real‚Äëmoney gaming platform WinZO has raised concerns over Google‚Äôs latest proposal to the Competition Commission of India (CCI), arguing that it does not adequately address the anti‚Äëcompetitive issues flagged in an ongoing investigation.The case originates from WinZO‚Äôs December 2022 complaint alleging that Google abused its dominant position by restricting Play Store access to only fantasy sports and rummy apps while excluding other real‚Äëmoney gaming categories. With Google controlling 96% of India‚Äôs app distribution market, WinZO said this policy inflated user acquisition costs by ‚Äúat least 10x‚Äù for apps distributed outside the Play Store.Acting on the complaint, the CCI in November 2024 ordered a formal investigation, citing prima facie violations of competition law, including the imposition of unfair conditions, denial of market access and limiting of market development. The Commission had noted Google‚Äôs lack of clear criteria for its pilot programme, inconsistent enforcement of its ads policy and ‚Äúmisleading payment warnings‚Äù shown to users sideloading apps, which it said artificially deterred usage.In a public notice issued recently the CCI invited comments on Google‚Äôs commitment offer. Google‚Äôs proposal includes allowing all real‚Äëmoney games that are certified by recognised third‚Äëparty bodies, replacing its pilot programme for fantasy sports and rummy apps and permitting certified skill‚Äëbased games to advertise on Google Ads. If approved, Google has committed to implement the Play Store changes within 120 days and its advertising changes within 150 days of the CCI‚Äôs order. The deadline for public comments is August 20, 2025.Responding to WinZO‚Äôs objections, a Google spokesperson said the company welcomed the CCI‚Äôs market testing of its proposed framework, describing it as the result of ‚Äúconstructive discussions‚Äù with the regulator and Indian developers. Google added that it is confident the proposal will create ‚Äúa more open and safe ecosystem‚Äù for real‚Äëmoney gaming apps, empower local developers and prioritise user safety.In its statement, WinZO said Google‚Äôs commitments ‚Äúmust be robust and genuinely eliminate the discriminatory practices identified,‚Äù adding that the proposed framework‚Äôs reference to ‚Äúdeveloping‚Äù a commercial model for real‚Äëmoney gaming lacked clear timelines or objective criteria.WinZO, which reported a 70% rise in revenue to Rs 1,055 crore and a 151% increase in profit to Rs 315 crore in FY24, said it will continue to participate in the consultation process ‚Äúto ensure fairness, transparency and a level playing field in India‚Äôs digital economy.‚Äù
Article Summary: WinZO has raised concerns over Google‚Äôs latest proposal to the Competition Commission of India. WinZO alleges that Google abused its dominant position by restricting Play Store access to only fantasy sports and rummy apps while excluding other real‚Äëmoney gaming categories. With Google controlling 96% of India's app distribution market, WinZo said this policy inflated user acquisition costs by ‚Äúat least 10x‚Äù

Article Title: Fortnite-maker Epic Games wins major victory as court upholds Google Play Store monopoly ruling
Article Text:
Google now must open Android to third-party app stores

Legal battle continues despite Epic's courtroom success

The US‚Äô Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals has rejected Google's appeal in the Epic Games lawsuit, affirming that Google's Play Store and payment systems constitute illegal monopolies. The decision forces Google to implement sweeping changes to Android's app ecosystem within three years, including allowing rival app stores on Google Play and ending exclusive payment requirements.The appeals court lifted a stay that had temporarily paused most injunction requirements while Google pursued its appeal, clearing the path for immediate implementation of the court-ordered remedies.Under the permanent injunction, Google faces unprecedented restrictions on its Android business model. The company must distribute competing app stores through Google Play and provide rivals with access to its complete app catalog.Epic Games CEO Tim Sweeney , who called this a "total victory," announced that the Epic Games Store for Android will launch directly within Google Play Store Google is also banned from requiring developers to use Google Play Billing and from striking revenue-sharing deals with device manufacturers to preinstall its store.Google plans to escalate its appeal to the Supreme Court, with the company warning that the decision "will significantly harm user safety, limit choice, and undermine innovation." The tech giant had argued that the injunction imposed "burdensome contractual restrictions" without justification.The case originated in 2020 when Epic embedded secret code in Fortnite to bypass Google's payment system, prompting Google to remove the popular game from its store. A 2023 jury unanimously found Google guilty of operating illegal monopolies in Android app distribution and in-app billing markets.Unlike Epic's largely unsuccessful lawsuit against Apple, the Google case revealed internal documents showing revenue-sharing agreements and concerns about competitive threats, helping Epic secure its landmark victory in the ongoing battle over mobile app store dominance.
Article Summary: Google must open Android to third-party app stores within three years. Google plans to escalate its appeal to the Supreme Court. Epic Games CEO Tim Sweeney announced that the Epic Games Store for Android will launch directly within Google Play Store. Epic embedded secret code in Fortnite to bypass Google's payment system.

Article Title: Apple CEO Tim Cook on Apple‚Äôs 18 Years journey to 3 Billion iPhones
Article Text: Apple has reached a significant milestone, shipping three billion iPhones since its 2007 launch, with a notable acceleration in recent years. The company's Q3 2025 earnings revealed substantial revenue, driven significantly by iPhone sales. Despite concerns about future competition from AI and potential tariff impacts, Apple's CEO remains confident in the iPhone's continued relevance.

Article Title: Intel‚Äôs manufacturing unit gets more ‚Äòbad news‚Äô after company CEO Lip-Bu Tan's major restructuring announcement
Article Text:
Representative Image

Other changes may be coming for Intel‚Äôs manufacturing process



What changes Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan has already announced



‚ÄúWe're developing Intel 14A ... from the ground up in close partnership with large external customers. Going forward, our investment in Intel 14A will be based on confirmed customer commitments.‚Äù

5 Tips to Get the Best Deals during sale on Amazon, Flipkart and other online websites

Intel's manufacturing unit faces more "bad news" as three senior executives in its operations are set to retire. This declaration from the company follows CEO Lip-Bu Tan 's announcement of major restructuring plans in its manufacturing unit. The latest announcement marks further change as Tan works to revitalise the struggling US-based chipmaker. According to a report by the news agency Reuters, Intel has confirmed that Kaizad Mistry and Ryan Russell, both corporate vice presidents in the technology development group, will retire. Additionally, Gary Patton, a corporate vice president at its Design Technology Platform organisation and a former IBM executive, is also retiring. The latest departures underscore the significant shifts occurring within Intel's manufacturing operations.Intel has also discussed internal changes to its technology development group, which oversees the creation of manufacturing processes. The Reuters report also cited two individuals familiar with the matter to claim. The company is also reportedly planning to scale down its manufacturing capacity planning team and reduce part of its engineering workforce, the sources told Reuters.Manufacturing operations are currently led by Naga Chandrasekaran , a former Micron Technology executive, who joined Intel about a year ago under previous CEO Pat Gelsinger. In March, Chandrasekaran‚Äôs role expanded to include both technology development and manufacturing. Since then, he has reorganised the teams under him, which provides for layoffs as part of broader global workforce reductions.Last week, during its quarterly earnings announcement, Intel‚Äôs new CEO announced several significant changes for the company. Tan, who stepped into the role in March, outlined a plan to reduce the company‚Äôs workforce to 75,000 by year-end, a cut of roughly 22%. The chipmaker also said it would adopt a more cautious approach to manufacturing investments.Intel added that the continuation of its next-generation 14A manufacturing process depends on landing a significant customer. Without one, the company may halt or abandon development.In a memo, Tan noted:Tan also informed investors that Intel‚Äôs 18A process would likely deliver a reasonable return only if applied to the company‚Äôs products.According to a previous report from Reuters, he has also considered discontinuing the offering of 18A technology to external clients to concentrate resources on the 14A process. Intel is reportedly planning to begin high-volume production of its Panther Lake PC chips later this year using the 18A process.
Article Summary: Intel's manufacturing unit faces more "bad news" as three senior executives in its operations are set to retire. This declaration from the company follows CEO Lip-Bu Tan's announcement of major restructuring plans in its manufacturing unit. The latest announcement marks further change as Tan works to revitalise the struggling US-based chipmaker.

Article Title: Anthropic CEO rejects Nvidia CEO Jensen Haung‚Äôs AI remarks: ‚ÄòThat's the most outrageous lie I've ever‚Ä¶.‚Äô
Article Text:
5 Tips to Get the Best Deals during sale on Amazon, Flipkart and other online websites

Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei has responded to Jensen Huang ‚Äôs previous remarks, stating his words are ‚Äúoutrageous‚Äù. "I've said nothing that anywhere near resembles the idea that this company should be the only one to build the technology," Amodei said, adding "‚Äô[=It's just an incredible and bad faith distortion."The feud started in June when the Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang said he disagreed with "almost everything" Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei said. Speaking at the Viva Tech conference earlier this year, Huang accused Amodei of believing AI is so dangerous that only his company should be allowed to build it ‚Äî an idea Huang described as unrealistic and monopolistic. "AI is so incredibly powerful that everyone will lose their jobs, which explains why they should be the only company building it," Huang then said of Amodei's thinking.In a latest episode of the "Big Technology" podcast hosted by Alex Kantrowitz, Anthropic CEO said ‚ÄúI've never said anything like that‚Äù, adding ‚ÄúThat's the most outrageous lie I've ever heard.‚ÄùDario Amodei said that he didn't know where "anyone could ever derive that from anything that I've said." Amodei insisted that in a "race to the bottom," AI companies rush to launch new features without enough safety checks, which puts everyone at risk. In contrast, his approach is a "race to the top," where the most responsible and ethical AI companies lead the way, setting higher standards for the entire industry."I've said multiple times, and I think Anthropic's actions have shown it, that we're aiming for something we call a race to the top," he added.In a related news, Dario Amodei warned employees against massive salary increases from competitors like Meta, stating it could "destroy" the company's culture. Speaking on the Big Technology Podcast, Amodei revealed that when Meta and other tech giants began targeting Anthropic engineers with lucrative offers, he sent a clear message to staff: the company would not compromise its compensation principles."What they are doing is trying to buy something that cannot be bought," Amodei said, explaining that many employees rejected external offers and some "wouldn't even talk to Mark Zuckerberg ." The CEO emphasized that Anthropic maintains a level-based compensation system where negotiations aren't permitted, calling it a matter of fairness.
Article Summary: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei has responded to Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang‚Äôs previous remarks, stating his words are ‚Äúoutrageous‚Äù Huang said he disagreed with "almost everything" Anthropic CEO said ‚ÄúI've never said anything like that‚Äù, adding ‚ÄúThat's the most outrageous lie I've ever heard"

NYT Connections is back with another thrilling word puzzle. If you are diving into today's New York Times Connections puzzle and find yourself stumped, you're not alone. This clever word game, updated daily, challenges players to sort 16 words into four related groups. Some connections are obvious, while others rely on wordplay, obscure references, or clever phrasing. Today‚Äôs puzzle, like many before it, mixes straightforward groupings with tricky ones that might require a second glance. Whether you're playing to maintain a long streak or just want to warm up your brain, we've gathered all the hints, group themes, and full answers you need to solve the July 31 edition.Connections is a daily word game by The New York Times that tests your ability to find hidden relationships among words. The goal is to identify four groups of four words that share a common link. These links can be thematic, structural, or even more subtle, like phrases or cultural references.You‚Äôre presented with a grid of 16 words and your task is to sort them into four groups of four related words. These groups vary in difficulty, with one usually being quite easy and another relying on wordplay or obscure connections. You can shuffle the grid to help you spot connections, and you have four chances to get it right before the game ends. If you're close to a correct grouping, the game might tell you that you're one word away. Playing on the New York Times website or app, you can also share your results and track your streak over time.Here are some subtle hints to guide your thinking:Here‚Äôs one example from each category to help nudge your thinking:That wraps up today‚Äôs puzzle. Whether you solved it solo or needed a boost, check back tomorrow for new clues and answers to keep your Connections streak going strong.
Article Summary: Connections is a daily word game by The New York Times that tests your ability to find hidden relationships among words. The goal is to identify four groups of four words that share a common link. These links can be thematic, structural, or even more subtle, like phrases or cultural references.

Article Title: Wordle today #1503: Get hints and answers to today's puzzle July 31, 2025
Article Text:
Wordle July 31, 2025: Here‚Äôs today‚Äôs hints, clues, and answer

Wordle hints and answers today

Wordle hints and clues for July 31

The word consists two vowels.

Today's Wordle word is 'RUFFLE'.

How did Wordle originate

Where can you play Wordle





How to play Wordle

Wordle FAQs

Can I play past Wordle puzzles?

No, Wordle is designed as a daily game with a unique puzzle each day. While you can‚Äôt play past puzzles on the official site, there are unofficial Wordle archives available where you can play previous games.

How do the color-coded tiles work in Wordle?

Green means the letter is correct and in the correct position.

Yellow means the letter is correct but in the wrong position.

Gray means the letter is not in the word at all.

How many guesses do I get in Wordle?

You have six chances to guess the correct five-letter word. After each guess, you receive feedback to help guide your next attempt.

Can I play Wordle more than once per day?

Wordle is designed as a daily puzzle, so you can only play one puzzle per day. The word of the day is the same for everyone globally, and once you complete it, you‚Äôll have to wait until the next day for a new puzzle.

Can letters repeat in Wordle?

Yes, repeated letters can appear in Wordle answers. Words containing duplicate letters can present more of a challenge when solving.

Is Wordle available in other languages?

Wordle is a popular word puzzle game that challenges players to guess a five-letter word within six attempts. Developed by Josh Wardle, this simple yet addictive game has taken the world by storm with its easy-to-understand rules and daily challenges. Each guess provides feedback with colored tiles: green indicates the correct letter in the correct spot, yellow signals the correct letter in the wrong spot, and gray means the letter isn't in the word. Wordle‚Äôs mix of logic and vocabulary makes it a daily brain teaser loved by millions worldwide. The game's minimalist design and once-a-day format have contributed to its viral success. It also fosters friendly competition, as players often share their results on social media without giving away the answer.The Wordle puzzle can be tricky to solve, which is likely why you‚Äôve found yourself here, struggling to crack today‚Äôs challenge. As always, today‚Äôs NYT Wordle was full of surprises, but don‚Äôt worry‚Äîwe‚Äôre here to help. Below, you‚Äôll find some helpful clues for today‚Äôs Wordle answer , and if those don‚Äôt do the trick, keep reading to discover the solution directly. Sometimes the word includes uncommon letters or double letters that throw players off.Today‚Äôs Wordle promises a puzzle that tests your linguistic skills, likely to be decoded by many participants. To assist you in solving the puzzle, we've curated a fresh array of hints and clues for today's Wordle challenge.Whether you have cracked the code or are still working with the hints, it is now time to reveal the answer.Wordle was initially developed by engineer Josh Wardle as a thoughtful gift for his partner. However, it quickly gained massive popularity, turning into a global sensation with thousands of players engaging daily. The game's success inspired fans to create various spin-offs, such as the battle royale-style Squabble, the music identification game Heardle, and multi-word challenges like Dordle and Quordle. Its simplicity, paired with daily novelty, made it a part of many people's morning routine. The viral appeal also sparked academic interest in its psychological and linguistic impact.As its popularity soared, The New York Times acquired Wordle, and it became a hit on social media platforms like TikTok, where creators even livestream their gameplay sessions.Wordle isn't available as an app; it can only be played through a web browser. To play, simply visit the New York Times Games website.Originally hosted on its own site and created by Josh Wardle, Wordle was acquired by the New York Times in February of this year. One of the great aspects of Wordle is that it‚Äôs ad-free, allowing you to fully concentrate on the word-guessing game.To play Wordle, visit the link https://www.nytimes.com/games/wordle/index.html and begin guessing words.Yes, there are multiple versions of Wordle available in various languages, including Spanish, French, and German. You can switch to a different language by finding the corresponding version of the game online.
Article Summary: Wordle is a daily puzzle game that challenges players to guess a five-letter word within six attempts. The word of the day is the same for everyone globally, and once you complete it, you‚Äôll have to wait until the next day for a new puzzle. The game's minimalist design and once-a-day format have contributed to its viral success.

What are NYT Strands and how to play the game?



Tips for solving NYT Strands puzzle



Identify the theme words: Fill in the grid with the theme words. Once found, they will be highlighted in blue and won't overlap with each other.

Find the Spangram: Identify the Spangram, a key part of the puzzle that connects two opposite sides of the grid. It encapsulates the theme and may consist of two words. The Spangram will be highlighted in yellow once you‚Äôve located it.

Take advantage of hints: Pay attention to off-topic words for clues. For every three non-theme words you uncover, letters will be highlighted to give you a hint toward finding a theme word, without directly revealing it.

The New York Times published its inaugural crossword puzzle on February 15, 1942, in the Sunday Magazine. Created by Charles Erlenkotter and edited by Margaret Farrar, it was the first major newspaper to feature a crossword puzzle. Over the years, the NYT has introduced several beloved games, including the Mini Crossword in 2014, followed by Spelling Bee, Letter Boxed, and Tiles. In 2022, the NYT launched the wildly popular Wordle, followed by additional games like Connections and Strands.NYT Strands is the latest addition to its puzzle offerings. This engaging daily game presents players with new themes each day, challenging them to uncover all the words on the grid. One of the game‚Äôs highlights is the special Spangram, which stretches across two sides of the board. With its innovative approach to word puzzles, Strands quickly became a fan favourite, adding to the diverse and exciting puzzle lineup of the New York Times.Having trouble solving today‚Äôs NYT Strands puzzle? We‚Äôre here to help with some easy hints to fuel your curiosity even more. Plus, we‚Äôve got today‚Äôs answer waiting for you ‚Äì just keep reading.Below, we‚Äôve shared the hints, answers, and Spangram for today‚Äôs NYT Strands puzzle. The hints may give away part or all of the Strands, so proceed with caution. Scroll down to continue:is the Spangram for today‚Äôs NYT Strands puzzle.Strands is a puzzle game that blends elements of Connections, Spelling Bee, and classic crossword puzzles. Players are given 48 letters arranged on a 6 x 8-inch grid, along with a daily theme. The goal is to solve the Spangram and uncover all the theme-related words.To play, connect letters on the grid to form words by dragging your mouse or fingers (on a touchscreen) in horizontal, vertical, or diagonal directions.Start by identifying the central theme word or Spangram, which will help you understand the puzzle‚Äôs theme.In addition to the Spangram, you must also find other words related to the theme hidden in the grid. Once you‚Äôve uncovered them all, the puzzle is complete.
Article Summary: Strands is a puzzle game that blends elements of Connections, Spelling Bee, and classic crossword puzzles. Players are given 48 letters arranged on a 6 x 8-inch grid, along with a daily theme. One of the game‚Äôs highlights is the special Spangram, which stretches across two sides of the board.

Article Title: Elon Musk says valuation of $20 trillion for Tesla is possible, but‚Ä¶.
Article Text: Investor Keith Fitz-Gerald recently said that Elon Musk-owned electric vehicle (EV) company Tesla is headed towards a $20 trillion valuation. He stated that ‚ÄúBetting against Elon is like betting against Steve Jobs (Apple founder)‚Äù. Responding to the comments, the Tesla CEO acknowledged that while the valuation is possible, it may require ‚Äòextreme execution‚Äô.‚ÄúExtreme execution is needed, but a valuation of $20 trillion for Tesla is possible,‚Äù Elon Musk wrote, quoting a post on X (formerly Twitter).Notably, this comes days after Elon Musk warned of ‚Äòfew rough quarters‚Äô for Tesla following the expiration of the US tax credit for EVs. In an earnings conference call with analysts and investors this week, the tech billionaire said ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre in this weird transition period where we‚Äôll lose a lot of incentives in the US.‚ÄùContinuing further, he said ‚ÄúWe probably could have a few rough quarters. I'm not saying we will, but we could‚Äù. ‚ÄúBut once you get to autonomy at scale in the second half of next year, certainly by the end of next year, I would be surprised if Tesla‚Äôs economics are not very compelling,‚Äù Musk added.The EV maker reported a drop in profit for the third quarter in a row, with earnings falling to $1.17 billion, or 33 cents per share, down from $1.4 billion, or 40 cents per share, during the same period last year.On an adjusted basis, the company earned 40 cents per share, which was in line with Wall Street expectations. Revenue for the April to June quarter also declined ‚Äî from $25.5 billion to $22.5 billion ‚Äî but still came in slightly higher than analysts had forecast.During the earnings calls, Elon Musk was asked about whether he would want more than his current 13% stake in Tesla to keep control. To this, Musk said he did want more but not too much.‚ÄúI think my control over Tesla should be enough to ensure that it goes in a good direction,‚Äù he said, ‚Äúbut not so much control that I can‚Äôt be thrown out if I go crazy.‚Äù
Article Summary: Investor Keith Fitz-Gerald recently said that Elon Musk-owned electric vehicle (EV) company Tesla is headed towards a $20 trillion valuation. Responding to the comments, the Tesla CEO acknowledged that while the valuation is possible, it may require 'extreme execution' This comes days after Elon Musk warned of ‚Äòfew rough quarters‚Äô for Tesla following the expiration of the US tax credit for EVs.

Article Title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang: Don't feel sad for my employees, I've created more billionaires on my management team than any CEO, they are doing just ...
Article Text:
Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang on personally rewarding high-performing employees



7 Reasons that make Samsung GALAXY Z FLIP7 different from others

Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang recently said that he has created more billionaires in his management than any CEO in the world. Speaking during an event hosted by the All-In Podcast team and a consortium of tech leaders and lawmakers known as the Hill and Valley Forum, Huang discussed the scale of impact that small, focused teams of AI researchers can have and how Nvidia‚Äôs success has translated into significant financial rewards for those in leadership. ‚ÄúI've created more billionaires on my management team than any CEO in the world. They're doing just fine. Don't feel sad for anybody at my layer.‚Äù Jensen Huang said. He was responding to a question on the effectiveness and value of smaller AI teams.‚ÄúBut the important big idea is that the impact of 150 or so AI researchers, with funding behind them, can probably create,‚Äù he noted. Jensen Huang gave examples of OpenAI which originally started with around 150 employees and China‚Äôs DeepSeek which also has a similar workforce.Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang added that there's something unique about well-structured, mid-sized teams when given the right resources. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs not a small team. That‚Äôs a good-size team with the right infrastructure‚Ä¶ If you're willing to pay, say, $20 billion, $30 billion to buy a startup with 150 AI researchers, why wouldn't you pay one?‚ÄùDuring the interview, the Nvidia CEO also addressed reports that he personally rewards high-performing employees with surprise stock options and RSUs (Restricted Stock Units). When asked if he actually does carry stock options, Jensen Huang joked ‚ÄúYeah, I'm carrying it in my pocket right now.‚ÄùHe then explained that he takes a hands-on approach to compensation across the company. ‚ÄúI review everybody‚Äôs compensation up to this day‚Ä¶ when they present it, and they send me everybody‚Äôs recommended comp, I go through the whole company. I‚Äôve got my methods of doing that, and I use machine learning. I sort through all 42,000 employees.‚Äù‚Äú100% of the time, I increased the company‚Äôs spend on OpEx [operating expenses]. And the reason for that is because you take care of people, everything else takes care [of itself],‚Äù Jensen Huang concluded.
Article Summary: N Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang recently said that he has created more billionaires in his management than any CEO in the world. He was responding to a question on the effectiveness and value of smaller AI teams. Huang also addressed reports that he personally rewards high-performing employees with surprise stock options and RSUs.

Article Title: Microsoft layoffs: CEO Satya Nadella in memo to employees after 15,000 job cuts, says success requires "difficult process of unlearning and ‚Ä¶"
Article Text:
Satya Nadella explains the "enigma of success" amid record profits and layoffs

AI transformation drives Microsoft‚Äôs workforce restructuring strategy

Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella addressed the company's massive job cuts in a candid memo to employees, acknowledging that recent layoffs affecting over 15,000 workers this year, have been "weighing heavily" on him while defending the cuts as necessary for the Redmond giant‚Äôs AI transformation."Before anything else, I want to speak to what's been weighing heavily on me, and what I know many of you are thinking about: the recent job eliminations," Nadella wrote to Microsoft's more than 200,000 employees. "These decisions are among the most difficult we have to make. They affect people we've worked alongside, learned from, and shared countless moments with ‚Äì our colleagues, teammates, and friends."The layoffs represent approximately 7% of Microsoft's global workforce, making it the company's largest personnel reduction since 2014. Despite the cuts, Microsoft's stock has soared 21% this year, hitting record highs above $500 per share, while the company reported $75 billion in net income over three fiscal quarters.Nadella directly addressed what he called the "uncertainty and seeming incongruence" of cutting jobs while the company thrives financially. "By every objective measure, Microsoft is thriving ‚Äì our market performance, strategic positioning, and growth all point up and to the right," he wrote. "We're investing more in CapEx than ever before. Our overall headcount is relatively unchanged, and some of the talent and expertise in our industry and at Microsoft is being recognized and rewarded at levels never seen before. And yet, at the same time, we've undergone layoffs."The CEO described this contradiction as "the enigma of success in an industry that has no franchise value," explaining that "progress isn't linear. It's dynamic, sometimes dissonant, and always demanding."Nadella emphasised that achieving future success "will be defined by our ability to go through this difficult process of 'unlearning' and 'learning.'" He argued this transformation requires Microsoft to "meet changing customer needs, by continuing to maintain and scale our current business, while also creating new categories with new business models and a new production function."The memo outlined Microsoft's strategic pivot from a "software factory to an intelligence engine" as the company invests $80 billion in AI infrastructure. Nadella envisions a future where "all 8 billion people could summon a researcher, an analyst, or a coding agent at their fingertips.""As we begin a new fiscal year, I've been reflecting on the road we've traveled together and the path ahead," Nadella wrote, positioning the layoffs within broader industry shifts toward AI-driven automation that have eliminated over 80,000 tech jobs in 2025.The CEO expressed "sincere gratitude to those who have left," acknowledging that "their contributions have shaped who we are as a company, helping build the foundation we stand on today." However, he offered no guarantees against future layoffs, instead urging remaining employees to maintain a "growth mindset" during what he called the "messiness" of transformation.
Article Summary: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella addressed the company's massive job cuts in a candid memo to employees. The layoffs represent approximately 7% of Microsoft's global workforce. Despite the cuts, Microsoft's stock has soared 21% this year, hitting record highs above $500 per share.

Article Title: Bill Gates says: When your daughter asks if you‚Äôd be willing to work a shift in customer service at her startup, the only right answer is ...
Article Text:
A lesson in leadership



Read Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates' complete LinkedIn post here



I‚Äôve entered the startup world again‚Ä¶

When your daughter asks if you‚Äôd be willing to work a shift in customer service at her startup, the only right answer is yes.

I‚Äôve spent a lot of time thinking about how technology can make systems more efficient, equitable, and accessible. But I‚Äôve learned over the years that the best way to understand how something works, or where it breaks, is to go straight to the people using it.

That‚Äôs why I‚Äôll be joining the Phia customer experience team for a day this week. Phia is a fashion-tech tool built to make shopping smarter and more sustainable, and it‚Äôs the brainchild of my daughter Phoebe Gates and her co-founder Sophia Kianni.

They‚Äôve built an app and browser extension that helps people shop smarter by finding the best prices, surfacing secondhand options, and showing lower-impact alternatives across thousands of online retailers.

It‚Äôs been inspiring to watch them tackle a massive challenge, rethinking the way we shop, by meeting users where they are.

And now, I‚Äôll be doing the same.

Looking forward to getting back into the startup scene. Hopefully, I won‚Äôt break anything (no promises).

üì≤Download the Phia iOS app for free at join.phia.com

üíªOr if you shop on your computer like me, they have a free chrome extension at gophia.com

Let me know what you think! You never know who‚Äôs on the other end of the customer service line‚Ä¶

Bill Gates daughter shared a piece of advice that she got from her mother



Big Question Answered: Why Google is Merging Android and ChromeOS

Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates, recently demonstrated a unique approach to leadership and family support by working a shift in customer service for his daughter Phoebe's new startup. In a LinkedIn post Bill Gates revealed that his daughter Phoebe Gates asked him to work a shift in customer service at her AI-powered fashion startup ‚Äî Phoebe and Gates agreed to it. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve entered the startup world again‚Ä¶ When your daughter asks if you‚Äôd be willing to work a shift in customer service at her startup, the only right answer is yes,‚Äù wrote Gates in a LinkedIn post.Phoebe Gates co-founded Phia along with her Stanford roommate Sophia Kianni. The platform uses AI to help users compare prices of new and second-hand products across more than 40,000 websites. A web browser/app, Phia aims to be the Booking.com of fashion, offering an instant price comparison from thousands of e-commerce sites for any item, new or used. Phoebe Gates is the youngest child of Bill Gates and his ex-wife, Melinda French Gates. Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates joined the customer service team of Phia for one day in order to understand how the product works.Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates revealed that this experience reminded him that ‚Äúthe best way to understand how something works‚Äîor where it breaks‚Äîis to go straight to the people using it.‚Äù His stint echoes a growing trend among tech CEOs to spend time on the front lines, following examples like Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi, who famously delivered food and drove passengers to better grasp user pain points.Earlier, in April this year, Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates shared that he intentionally chose not to invest in his daughter‚Äôs AI-powered shopping app, Phia, during a podcast. He explained that funding the venture would have led him to oversee it too closely. Instead, he offered advice on staffing while others handled the investment. "In an interview published by the New York Times, soon after Phia‚Äôs web browser and app went live, Bill Gates said: ‚ÄúI thought, ‚ÄòOh boy, she‚Äôs going to come and ask.‚Äù‚ÄúI would have kept her on a short leash and be doing business reviews, which I would have found tricky,‚Äù the businessman explained of his hesitance. ‚ÄúAnd I probably would have been overly nice but wondered if it was the right thing to do.‚ÄùPhoebe Gates recently shared a piece of advice that she got from her mother, Melinda French Gates, about tackling investors. The 22-year-old co-founder of fashion pricing startup Phia got this advice from her mother after she faced queries from potential investors about her future motherhood. While raising funds for Phia with co-founder Sophia Kianni, Gates was asked what would happen if they decided to have children. On the Call Her Daddy podcast, Phoebe shared that this line of questioning prompted a call to her mother. She noted that her mother‚Äôs reply was: "Get up or get out of the game, sis."According to a report by Benzinga, both founders said that these inquiries expose a persistent bias in venture capital. ‚ÄúAlways children,‚Äù Melinda Gates said when asked to name the most common bias they‚Äôve faced. Kianni said she turned the tables on a male investor by asking: "What's going to happen to your venture firm when you have kids?""He's like, ‚ÄòWhy would that affect anything?' And I was like, ‚ÄòYou answered your own question,'‚Äù she added.
Article Summary: Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates worked a shift in customer service for his daughter Phoebe's new startup, Phia. Phia is an app and browser extension that helps people shop smarter by finding the best prices, surfacing secondhand options, and showing lower-impact alternatives across thousands of online retailers. Bill Gates joined the customer service team of Phia for one day in order to understand how the product works.

Article Title: Who is Bryan Johnson: Anti-aging champion who spent $2 million a year on his body now set to shut down or sell age-reversing startup due to financial losses
Article Text: Bryan Johnson, the tech entrepreneur known for his anti-aging pursuits, is discontinuing his age-reversal startup, Blueprint, citing financial losses and a desire to concentrate on his philosophical movement, "Don't Die." Johnson, famous for his intense health regimen, aims to fully dedicate himself to this new mission, viewing commercial ventures as distractions from his goal of reshaping humanity's relationship with death.
Article Summary: Bryan Johnson is discontinuing his age-reversal startup, Blueprint, citing financial losses and a desire to concentrate on his philosophical movement, "Don't Die" Johnson, famous for his intense health regimen, aims to fully dedicate himself to this new mission.

Article Title: Apple releases public beta for iOS 26, iPadOS 26, macOS 26 Tahoe, and its other OS' with Liquid Glass design
Article Text:
Apple‚Äôs new software update brings Liquid Glass‚Äô transparency among bunch of other changes

iOS 26, iOS 26, macOS 26 Tahoe public release expected in September

Apple launched the first public beta versions of its upcoming operating systems on Thursday, allowing early adopters to experience the company's most significant visual overhaul since iOS 7. The release includes iOS 26, iPadOS 26 , macOS Tahoe 26, watchOS 26, and tvOS 26, all featuring the new "Liquid Glass" design language that emphasizes transparency and light refraction throughout the user interface.The centerpiece of this update is the Liquid Glass aesthetic, which transforms icons, menu buttons, navigation bars, and interface elements with subtle animations that reflect and refract light. Apple has integrated this design throughout key applications including Phone, Camera, Safari, and Music, as well as system areas like the Lock Screen, Control Center, and Home Screen.Beyond visual changes, the update delivers significant functionality improvements across all platforms. iOS 26 introduces real-time live translation for Messages, Phone, and FaceTime apps, plus a new Call Screening feature that prompts unknown callers to identify themselves. The Phone app also gains Hold Assist to notify users when hold music ends. A dedicated gaming app now serves as a centralized destination for discovering and playing games, while users can customize alarm snooze times and enjoy updated Genmoji and Image Playground features.iPadOS 26 brings Mac-like functionality with the Preview app for PDF annotation and a new windowing system for managing multiple applications and web pages simultaneously. macOS Tahoe 26 enhances Spotlight with AI-powered search anticipation and adds Live Activities synced with iPhones for accessing recent calls and contacts.The watchOS 26 beta introduces Workout Buddy, an AI fitness coach providing personalized motivation, alongside automatic volume adjustment that adapts to surrounding sound levels and a new one-handed flick gesture for dismissing notifications. The tvOS 26 beta enables seamless profile switching when Apple TV wakes from sleep and allows iPhones to function as microphones for Apple Music sing-alongs with on-screen lyrics.Users can access the public betas through Apple's beta website after registration. The company strongly recommends installing beta software only on secondary devices due to potential stability issues.The stable versions of iOS 26, iPadOS, macOS 26 and other OS‚Äô are expected to launch this fall, representing Apple's most comprehensive operating system update in years with the unified Liquid Glass design language spanning all platforms.
Article Summary: Apple launched the first public beta versions of its upcoming operating systems on Thursday. The release includes iOS 26, iPadOS 26, macOS Tahoe 26, watchOS 26, and tvOS 26. All feature the new "Liquid Glass" design language that emphasizes transparency and light refraction throughout the user interface.

Article Title: Sundar Pichai joins the ‚Äòbillionaire club‚Äô after leading Google for over a decade; his net worth is‚Ä¶
Article Text:
Sundar Pichai achieves rare feat as a non-founder CEO

AI-powered growth and record investments

From modest beginnings to Silicon Valley‚Äôs summit

After a decade at the helm of Alphabet, Sundar Pichai has officially joined the ranks of billionaires, marking a rare achievement for a non-founding tech CEO. Pichai, who took over as CEO of Google in 2015 and became Alphabet‚Äôs chief in 2019, now holds a net worth of $1.1 billion, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. The milestone comes after Alphabet‚Äôs market value soared by over $1 trillion since early 2023, delivering 120% returns to investors. Pichai‚Äôs rise has been defined by his leadership through multiple technological shifts, from mobile and cloud computing to AI. As Alphabet‚Äôs shares hit record highs, his decade-long stewardship has culminated in both financial success and strategic transformation.While tech billionaires are often company founders, Pichai‚Äôs entry into the billionaire club is different. He holds just 0.02% of Alphabet‚Äôs economic stake, currently valued at around $440 million. Most of his net worth comes from share sales and performance-based compensation over the past ten years. Bloomberg reports that he has sold over $650 million in stock during his tenure. If he had retained all his shares, they would now be worth more than $2.5 billion. Despite the modest stake, Pichai‚Äôs long-term vision and steady leadership have driven massive growth in Alphabet‚Äôs core businesses.August 2025 marks ten years since Pichai became CEO of Google. In that time, Alphabet has expanded rapidly, turning once-nascent divisions like YouTube, Cloud, Play, and Subscriptions into billion-dollar engines. In a recent post on X, Pichai highlighted that in 2015, Alphabet‚Äôs total revenue was $75 billion, whereas YouTube and Google Cloud alone are now generating an annual run rate of $110 billion. Under his leadership, Alphabet restructured into a parent holding company, sharpened its AI focus, and increased its global footprint.A major factor in Alphabet‚Äôs recent trillion-dollar surge has been its aggressive AI investments . The company spent $50 billion in 2023 alone on infrastructure, semiconductors, and data centers to support its AI ambitions. It also raised its 2025 capital expenditure forecast by $10 billion, reaching $85 billion, most of which is earmarked for AI infrastructure. ‚ÄúOur AI infrastructure investments are crucial to meeting the growth in demand for cloud customers,‚Äù Pichai said during the Q2 earnings call. Alphabet‚Äôs DeepMind acquisition in 2014 for $400 million has also paid off, helping the company stay ahead in the AI race. Pichai's rise reflects a new era where operational excellence, not just founding status, can build tech empires.Born in Tamil Nadu, India, Sundar Pichai‚Äôs journey to Silicon Valley is one of resilience and brilliance. He grew up in a two-room apartment, with his first telephone arriving when he was 12. A scholarship brought him to Stanford in 1993, with a one-way plane ticket that reportedly cost more than his father‚Äôs annual salary. Pichai joined Google in 2004, led the development of Chrome, and later oversaw Android, before rising to the top job.Sundar Pichai is also known for his calm, consensus-driven leadership style, which has earned him respect in an industry often defined by bold personalities. In recent years, he has become increasingly vocal on topics like AI regulation, digital privacy, and ethical tech, positioning Alphabet as a global thought leader beyond just innovation.Outside of tech, Pichai has also ventured into sports. He is reportedly part of a group of executives that acquired a 49% stake in the London Spirit cricket team for $182 million. The team competes in The Hundred, a professional cricket league launched in the UK in 2020. While his wealth may not rival that of Alphabet founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin, worth $171.2 billion and $160.4 billion respectively, Pichai's path to the billionaire club is proof that transformational leadership, even without a founding stake, can build both companies and fortunes. His rise underscores a shift in Silicon Valley‚Äôs power dynamics‚Äîwhere disciplined execution rivals disruptive invention. As Alphabet charts its future, Pichai‚Äôs story stands as a model for aspiring global leaders in tech and beyond.
Article Summary: Sundar Pichai has officially joined the ranks of billionaires, marking a rare achievement for a non-founding tech CEO. The milestone comes after Alphabet‚Äôs market value soared by over $1 trillion since early 2023, delivering 120% returns to investors. His rise has been defined by his leadership through multiple technological shifts, from mobile and cloud computing to AI.

Article Title: Apple CEO Tim Cook reveals that this is most-popular iPhone in the world right now
Article Text:
Apple CEO Tim Cook confirms iPhone 16 is the most-popular iPhone in the world



Apple has shipped 3 billion iPhones



Cupertino-based tech giant Apple delivered a strong third quarter for fiscal 2025. The company posted a record June quarter revenue of $94 billion with up to 10% year-over-year growth and supercharged iPhone 16 sales . In an interview with CNBC, Apple CEO Tim Cook revealed that the right now iPhone 16 series is the most-popular iPhone lineup in the world. Cook added that the iPhone 16 lineup has surpassed the performance of the iPhone 15 lineup which the company launched in 2023. During the Q3 earnings call, Apple posted $44.6 billion in iPhone revenue, suggesting a year-over-year increase of 13%.The statement made by Cook is an important indicator of the iPhone 16's market performance. This also means that the users who went for an upgrade liked the new features, camera enhancements, and design updates the company introduced with iPhone 16 lineup.Talking to CNBC, Cook said that iPhone 16 witnessed a sales growth in ‚Äòstrong double digits‚Äô as compared to the iPhone 15 during the same period last year. He attributed the surge to a wave of upgrades from existing iPhone users, noting that the entire lineup‚Äîincluding the iPhone 16, 16 Plus, 16 Pro, and 16 Pro Max‚Äîhas resonated well with consumers.‚ÄúCook said iPhone revenue was strong because the iPhone 16 is more popular compared to the iPhone 15 devices on sale last year at the same time. Cook said iPhone 16 sales were up ‚Äústrong double digits‚Äù versus its predecessor. Cook specifically highlighted popularity among current iPhone users upgrading to a new one,‚Äù mentions the report.Apple CEO also revealed that the company has shipped three billion iPhones since the launch of the original iPhone 18 years ago, in 2007. During Apple‚Äôs third-quarter earnings call, CEO Tim Cook revealed that the company shipped its three billionth iPhone during the quarter. Apple also reported $94 billion in revenue, with iPhone sales contributing $44.6 billion, nearly half of its total quarterly revenue.iPhone sales jumped 13% year-over-year in the quarter ending June 2025, with analysts suggesting tariff concerns may have driven purchases. Bloomberg reporter Mark Gurman noted that consumers likely bought iPhones fearing future price increases due to President Trump's proposed tariffs, which already cost Apple $800 million last quarter and are projected to reach $1.1 billion next quarter.
Article Summary: Apple has shipped 3 billion iPhones since the launch of the original iPhone 18 years ago, in 2007. During Apple‚Äôs third-quarter earnings call, CEO Tim Cook revealed that the company shipped its three billionth iPhone during the quarter. Apple also reported $94 billion in revenue, with iPhone sales contributing $44.6 billion.

Article Title: Spotify Playlist of Sam Altman, JD Vance, Palmer Luckey, Karoline Leavitt, Pam Bondi and others leaked in Panama Playlists
Article Text:
Panama Playlsits: What Sam Altman, JD Vance and others listen to on Spotify



‚ÄúI can confirm that this playlist is real. My life Would s**k Without You.‚Äù

5 Tips to Get the Best Deals during sale on Amazon, Flipkart and other online websites

A newly published collection of data named "Panama Playlists" has leaked the Spotify listening habits of several prominent figures, a report claims. This includes Spotify playlists of OpenAI CEO Sam Altman, US Vice President JD Vance, defence tech maker Anduril‚Äôs CEO Palmer Luckey, White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt and US Attorney General Pam Bondi. This collection, which an anonymous individual has reportedly curated, provides a glimpse into the musical preferences of politicians, journalists and tech leaders. The website is also said to contain data for several other notable individuals, such as Speaker of the House Mike Johnson and Late Night host Seth Meyers.The ‚ÄúPanama Playlists‚Äù reportedly revealed the Spotify playlist of OpenAI CEO Sam Altman. According to the site, his ‚ÄúMy Shazam Tracks‚Äù playlist features songs of David Guetta and OneRepublic‚Äôs ‚ÄúI Don‚Äôt Wanna Wait,‚Äù as well as Missy Elliott‚Äôs ‚ÄúGet Ur Freak On.‚ÄùAccording to a report by The Verge, five people who were among the ones featured on the site have even confirmed the accuracy of their data. In a post shared on the social media platform X (earlier Twitter), commenting on his leaked Spotify playlist, Anduril CEO Palmer Luckey wrote:The report claims that Luckey has two accounts on Spotify, one of which is named ‚ÄúPalmer Freeman Luckey,‚Äù which contains the ‚ÄúBest Music Ever‚Äù playlist that the Panama Playlists revealed.Among the other notable names were Vice President JD Vance, whose ‚ÄúMaking Dinner‚Äù playlist reportedly includes tracks like ‚ÄúI Want It That Way‚Äù by the Backstreet Boys and Justin Bieber‚Äôs ‚ÄúOne Time,‚Äù according to the site.In some cases, the data goes beyond playlists ‚Äî for instance, Meta‚Äôs chief AI officer, Alexandr Wang, is said to have played The Lumineers‚Äô ‚ÄúStubborn Love‚Äù right after Meta invested $14 billion in Scale AI.A Spotify profile under the name Adam Mosseri that showed a ‚ÄúHang‚Äù playlist, also appeared on the Panama Playlists website, the report added.Another report by the New York Post claimed that the site and is operated by an anonymous investigator who says they‚Äôve been ‚Äúscraping‚Äù the Spotify accounts of celebrities, politicians, and journalists since summer 2024.The investigator also claimed that the site had access to ‚Äúplaylists, live listening feed, everything," including details like what songs were played, when, and how often.Meanwhile, a Spotify spokesperson told The Independent that if the webiste is using a Spotify account to extract information from public playlists, it would be a violation of the platform‚Äôs Terms of Use.The spokesperson also highlighted guidelines that prohibit sharing any content made available through the streaming service with the public.
Article Summary: A newly published collection of data named "Panama Playlists" has leaked the Spotify listening habits of several prominent figures. This includes Spotify playlists of OpenAI CEO Sam Altman, US Vice President JD Vance, White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt and US Attorney General Pam Bondi. The website is also said to contain data for several other notable individuals, such as Speaker of the House Mike Johnson and Late Night host Seth Meyers.

Article Title: OpenAI rolls back new ChatGPT feature just hours after launch, top exec says: We removed a feature from ChatGPT app that allowed users to ...
Article Text:
OpenAI rolls back new ChatGPT feature over privacy concerns



Read OpenAI's chief information security officer Dane Stuckey‚Äôs complete post here



We just removed a feature from

@ChatGPTapp

that allowed users to make their conversations discoverable by search engines, such as Google. This was a short-lived experiment to help people discover useful conversations. This feature required users to opt-in, first by picking a chat to share, then by clicking a checkbox for it to be shared with search engines (see below).

Ultimately we think this feature introduced too many opportunities for folks to accidentally share things they didn't intend to, so we're removing the option. We're also working to remove indexed content from the relevant search engines. This change is rolling out to all users through tomorrow morning.

Security and privacy are paramount for us, and we'll keep working to maximally reflect that in our products and features.
Article Summary: OpenAI rolls back new ChatGPT feature over privacy concerns. Feature required users to opt-in, first by picking a chat to share, then by clicking a checkbox for it to be shared with search engines. This change is rolling out to all users through tomorrow morning.

Article Title: New UPI rules starting today, August 1 for users of Google Pay, Paytm, PhonePay and others
Article Text:
Cap on balance enquiries via UPI



Limit on bank account access via ‚Äúlist account‚Äù API

Restrictions on UPI Autopay during peak hours

5 Tips to Get the Best Deals during sale on Amazon, Flipkart and other online websites

National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) has reportedly rolled out new United Payments Interface (UPI) rules starting today, i.e. August 1, 2025. According to an Economic Times report, NPCI has issued a set of new guidelines that must be followed by UPI ecosystem members starting today. These changes include limiting daily balance enquiry requests, regulating use of APIs and more. The report cites NPCI‚Äôs compliance notice dated May 21, which mandates Payment Service Providers (PSPs), UPI apps, and banks to put these changes in place by July 31, 2025.One of the major changes coming to UPI as reported by ET is a limit on how many times users can check their bank balance. Now, balance enquiries are limited to 50 per app per customer in a 24-hour period, as per the report.These balance checks must be started by the user ‚Äî apps and systems are not allowed to trigger them automatically. Also, UPI apps must add a feature that lets them reduce or pause such requests during busy hours to avoid pressure on the system.To cut down on unnecessary balance checks, NPCI has also asked issuer banks to include the available account balance in every successful UPI transaction message.NPCI, ET report says, has placed limits on the use of the ‚Äúlist account‚Äù API, which shows users the bank accounts linked to their mobile number. This feature is now limited to 25 requests per app per customer per day. It can only be used after the user selects their bank in the app.If the app needs to retry the process, it must ask the user for permission first. This is meant to make things clearer and avoid unnecessary system calls.To reduce traffic during busy times, UPI Autopay transactions will now be allowed only during non-peak hours. NPCI defines peak hours as 10:00 AM to 1:00 PM and 5:00 PM to 9:30 PM.Each autopay instruction will be allowed one initial attempt and up to three retries, meaning no more than four total attempts per mandate.
Article Summary: National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) has reportedly rolled out new United Payments Interface (UPI) rules starting today, i.e. August 1, 2025. These changes include limiting daily balance enquiry requests, regulating use of APIs and more. NPCI has also asked issuer banks to include the available account balance in every successful UPI transaction message.

Article Title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang: I use words pain and suffering inside our company a lot, because ...
Article Text:
Jensen Haung reveals phrases he often uses at Nvidia

5 Tips to Get the Best Deals during sale on Amazon, Flipkart and other online websites

Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang recently shared his ‚Äòmantra‚Äô of success. Speaking at an event recently, Huang said ‚Äúresilience matters in success‚Äù, adding that success often comes from facing setbacks and hardships. ‚ÄúPeople with very high expectations have very low resilience. Unfortunately, resilience matters in success,‚Äù the Nvidia CEO said. ‚ÄúI don't know how to teach it to you, except for I hope suffering happens to you,‚Äù he added.Jensen Huang explained that his own experiences growing up helped shape his character. While his parents supported him, he still faced challenges. These difficulties, he said, helped him grow stronger. ‚ÄúI was fortunate that I grew up with my parents, providing a condition for us to be successful, on the one hand, but there were plenty of opportunities for setbacks and sufferings,‚Äù he said.Jensen Huang revealed that he often uses the phrase ‚Äòpain and suffering‚Äô at the company. ‚ÄúTo this day, I used the phrase pain and suffering inside our company with great glee,‚Äù he said, adding ‚ÄúAnd the reason is this is gonna cause a lot of pain and suffering ‚Äì I mean that in a happy way.‚Äù‚ÄúBecause you want to refine the character of your company. You want greatness out of them.‚ÄùAccording to the Nvidia CEO, greatness does not come from intelligence. Greatness, he said ‚Äúcomes from character and character isn't formed out of small people. It is formed out of people who have suffered.‚ÄùJensen Huang‚Äôs comments highlight his belief that difficult moments can play a key role in personal growth and long-term success ‚Äî both for individuals and for companies.Last month, Nvidia achieved a major milestone by becoming the first-ever company to reach a market valuation of $4 trillion. The chipmaker‚Äôs rise is fueled by the increased demand for AI chips globally.
Article Summary: Jensen Huang revealed that he often uses the phrase ‚Äòpain and suffering‚Äô at the company. ‚ÄúTo this day, I used the phrase pain and suffering inside our company with great glee,‚Äù he said. Greatness, he said ‚Äúcomes from character and character isn't formed out of small people. It is formed out out of people who have suffered‚Äù

Article Title: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy who sent shockwaves with AI means fewer jobs stance, says: Having AI do a lot of the coding for us ‚Ä¶ allows employees to‚Ä¶
Article Text:
Andy Jassy, CEO of Amazon

CEO highlights concrete AI implementations across Amazon‚Äôs business operations

5 Tips to Get the Best Deals during sale on Amazon, Flipkart and other online websites

Amazon CEO Andy Jassy struck a more optimistic tone about artificial intelligence‚Äôs impact on workers during the company‚Äôs July 31 earnings call, months after warning that AI would lead to fewer jobs across the tech giant‚Äôs 1.5 million-person workforce.‚ÄúAI will make all our teammates‚Äô jobs more enjoyable,‚Äù Jassy said, emphasizing that the technology would free employees from ‚Äúrote‚Äù functions that previously couldn‚Äôt be automated. He added that ‚Äúcoding agents, having AI do a lot of the coding for us ‚Ä¶ allows our teammates to start from a much more advanced starting spot.‚ÄùAmazon pivots messaging after employee backlash over job displacement warningsThe comments mark a notable shift from Jassy‚Äôs stark June 17 internal memo that told employees ‚Äúwe will need fewer people doing some of the jobs that are being done today.‚Äù That warning sparked sharp internal criticism, with one worker sarcastically writing on company Slack channels: ‚ÄúThere is nothing more motivating on a Tuesday than reading that your job will be replaced by AI in a few years.‚ÄùJassy explained that companies face a choice in the AI revolution: they can ‚Äúembrace the change that‚Äôs happening and help shape the new era, or you can wish it away and have it shape you.‚Äù He said Amazon has chosen to embrace this transformative moment.The Amazon chief detailed how AI is already reshaping the company‚Äôs operations, from coding assistance that saved programmers ‚Äú4,500 years of work‚Äù to customer service automation through AWS Connect. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs changing the way Amazon does coding, finance, all sorts of things,‚Äù Jassy explained, noting AI‚Äôs impact on ‚Äúbusiness process automation‚Äù and customer service.Amazon currently operates more than 1,000 generative AI services across its business units, including the next-generation Alexa+ assistant and AI-powered shopping tools used by tens of millions of customers worldwide. The company has also deployed its millionth robot at a fulfillment center in Japan.Despite the more positive messaging, Amazon has already eliminated more than 27,000 jobs since 2022 through rolling layoffs, with additional workforce reductions continuing in 2025. Amazon‚Äôs stock dropped roughly 7% in post-market trading following the earnings call.
Article Summary: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy struck a more optimistic tone about artificial intelligence‚Äôs impact on workers. Jassy said AI would free employees from ‚Äúrote‚Äù functions that previously couldn‚Äôt be automated. Amazon has already eliminated more than 27,000 jobs since 2022 through rolling layoffs.

Article Title: Google Cloud sets Guinness World Records title for 'Largest AI Agent Training Event'
Article Text:
Highlights from the Hackathon



Google Cloud India has officially entered the record books, securing a Guinness World Records title for hosting the largest Agentic AI hackathon during its landmark Agentic AI Day 2025 event. Held on July 27 in collaboration with Hack2Skill, the event brought together over 2,000 developers forming more than 700 AI-first teams for a high-energy, 30-hour innovation sprint.A total of 1,941 developers were adjudicated to break the world record, tackling six real-world problem statements ranging from urban data overload to personalized financial coaching . The winning teams built functional MVPs using Google Cloud‚Äôs AI ecosystem, including Gemini 2.5 Pro, Vertex AI, AI Studio, and Firebase Studio."We are incredibly proud to have been recognized by Guinness World Records for this achievement," a Google spokesperson said. "Agentic AI Day was more than just a training session; it was a testament to the future of AI. Our goal is to empower developers to build intelligent agents that can solve real-world problems, and this event proved that our platform is ready to support that vision at an unparalleled scale."With over 57,000 registrations and more than 1 million online impressions, the event not only broke records‚Äîit ignited a movement. Want to explore what Agentic AI means or how these tools can be used in your own projects? I‚Äôd be thrilled to walk you through it.* Arealis Agents: Built a platform to manage city data overload using real-time analytics and visualization tools.* GuruMitra: Created an offline-first AI platform for multi-grade classrooms, supporting 22+ Indian languages.* Blue Bird: Developed CrowdSense, a privacy-first crowd intelligence system for public event safety.* Kovai Shines: Introduced an AI Farming Companion for crop diagnosis and market insights.* Raah: Launched Raseed, an AI-powered receipt manager integrated with Google Wallet.* unicorn.ai: Built Artha, a personal finance coach that automates ITR filing and offers year-round guidance.
Article Summary: Google Cloud India has officially entered the record books for hosting the largest Agentic AI hackathon. Held on July 27, the event brought together over 2,000 developers forming more than 700 AI-first teams. The winning teams built functional MVPs using Google Cloud‚Äôs AI ecosystem.

Article Title: You run the risk of killing ‚Ä¶: Meta chief AI scientist Yann LeCun to Elon Musk on his engineers vs researchers comment
Article Text:
What Elon Musk said about Researchers and Engineers



5 Tips to Get the Best Deals during sale on Amazon, Flipkart and other online websites

The debate over the future of artificial intelligence (AI) development has taken a new turn, with Meta‚Äôs chief AI scientist, Yann LeCun , has openly disagreed with Elon Musk 's latest move at his startup, xAI . LeCun slammed Musk‚Äôs take on eliminating the ‚Äúresearcher‚Äù job title in favour of ‚Äúengineer.‚Äù The Meta executive said that both have different roles and the Tesla CEO may be risking ‚Äúkilling breakthrough innovation.‚ÄùIn a long post on LinkedIn, LeCun shared a screenshot of Musk‚Äôs post and explained the difference between all the roles. He argued that blurring the lines between the two roles could stifle innovation.‚ÄúThere is a difference between research and engineering in (1) modus operandi, (2) methodology, (3) openness, (4) evaluation criteria,‚Äù he wrote.‚ÄúIf you make no distinction between the two activities, if you don't evaluate researchers and engineers with different criteria, you run the risk of killing breakthrough innovation,‚Äù LeCun stated.He further emphasised that true breakthroughs require ‚Äúteams with a long horizon and minimal constraints from product development and management.‚ÄùLeCun pointed to the history of scientific and technological progress, arguing that the most impactful innovations came from dedicated research labs that were distinct from engineering divisions.‚ÄúThe industry research labs of yore that have left an indelible mark on scientific and technological progress (Bell Labs Area 11, IBM Research, Xerox PARC, etc) were all research divisions that were clearly separate from engineering divisions,‚Äù he said.LeCun‚Äôs response came two days after Musk shared a post on X (formerly Twitter) that xAI would be eliminating the ‚Äúresearcher‚Äù job title in favour of ‚Äúengineer.‚Äù‚ÄúThis false nomenclature of 'researcher' and 'engineer', which is a thinly-masked way of describing a two-tier engineering system, is being deleted from @xAI today. Researcher is a relic term from academia,‚Äù Musk wrote.Musk is not the first to challenge this distinction. Other major AI companies have also moved away from the traditional ‚Äúresearcher‚Äù title. In a 2023 post on X, OpenAI president Greg Brockman said the company preferred to avoid such rigid buckets and instead uses the title ‚ÄúMember of Technical Staff.‚ÄùAnthropic, the creator of the Claude AI model, also uses the same title, with its careers page stating, ‚ÄúWhile there's historically been a division between engineering and research in machine learning, we think that boundary has dissolved with the advent of large models.‚Äù
Article Summary: Yann LeCun, Meta‚Äôs chief AI scientist, has openly disagreed with Elon Musk's latest move at his startup, xAI. The Tesla CEO said xAI would be eliminating the ‚Äúresearcher‚Äù job title in favour of ‚Äúengineer‚Äù The Meta executive said that both have different roles and the Tesla CEO may be risking ‚Äúkilling breakthrough innovation.‚Äù

Article Title: Google, GPT Emerge as go-to "Therapists" for overthinking Indians: Report
Article Text: Indians are increasingly turning to technology to deal with everyday uncertainty, with one in three saying they‚Äôve used Google or ChatGPT to navigate overthinking‚Äîfrom decoding a short message to choosing the right gift, according to the Center fresh‚ÄìYouGov ‚ÄúIndia Overthinking Report.‚ÄùThe nationwide survey of students, professionals, and self-employed individuals across Tier 1‚Äì3 towns highlights how second-guessing has become an everyday habit. The report finds 81% of Indians spend more than three hours a day overthinking, while 42% assume the worst when their boss sends a one-word ‚ÄúOk‚Äù reply. Even simple tasks‚Äîlike deciding what to eat‚Äîtrigger more stress than choosing political leaders, with 63% saying picking a dish at a restaurant is harder than selecting an election candidate.Social media adds to the mental load: 61% of respondents say they overthink for at least five hours when uploading stories, worrying about everything from music and filters to how quickly others view their posts.‚ÄúThrough the Center Fresh India Overthinking Report , our aim was to decode how overthinking manifests in today‚Äôs hyper-connected world‚Äîand the insights are eye-opening. Whether it‚Äôs second-guessing a message or overanalysing a dinner choice, overthinking has quietly become an everyday habit, cutting across ages and regions. By spotlighting this mental clutter, the report sparks a much-needed conversation about the importance of everyday mental clarity. Center Fresh, with its refreshing minty gel core, helps break that loop‚Äîreminding you to trust your instincts,‚Äù said Gunjan Khetan, Director, Marketing, Perfetti Van Melle India.
Article Summary: One in three say they‚Äôve used Google or ChatGPT to navigate overthinking. Even simple tasks trigger more stress than choosing political leaders. 61% of respondents say they overthink for at least five hours when uploading stories, worrying about everything from music and filters.
